column4: Is it normal for Gnome Battery Charge Monitor to take a l-o-n-g time to identify AC Power and Battery power?
My iBook takes a two or three seconds.
Fujitsu Siemens S-4546 (P3-600, 256MB RAM, 10GB Hardrive, Intel440MX Chipset)
more then 3 minutes, or me refreshing the gnome panel...
yesterday all was good but my HD crashed terrible so i had to wipe everything etc... the only change i did was disable PNP BIOS, maybe I should enable it ?
I get confused. what does that setting say anyway, Linux isn't a PNP OS...
Linux back in, like, 1997 wasn't.  But things have changed since then.
PnP is about the way some low-level stuff works, not about the user experience. :)
yeah, I read a document about it the other day...
- you the man !!! it works now !
and the battery time/precentage is accurate too...
